#### Fine Root Ecology Database: FRED (compilation)

*Description*: Originally a plant root database but also contains some soil laboratory data and soil observations. Fully documented in @iversen2017global.

```{r point-map-fred-v3, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of FRED points. Image source: Oak Ridge National Laboratory.", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-fred-v3.png")
```

-   `r emo::ji("link")` Project website: <https://roots.ornl.gov/>\
-   `r emo::ji("open_file_folder")` Data download URL: <https://doi.org/10.25581/ornlsfa.014/1459186>\
-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license: <https://roots.ornl.gov/guidelines/>\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Iversen, C. M., McCormack, M. L., Powell, A. S., Blackwood, C. B., Freschet, G. T., Kattge, J., ... & Violle, C. (2017). [A global Fine‐Root Ecology Database to address below‐ground challenges in plant ecology](https://doi.org/10.1111/nph.14486). New Phytologist, 215(1), 15-26.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations:\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows: 150,000\
-   `r emo::ji("memo")` Tutorials & documentation: <https://roots.ornl.gov/guidelines/>

## Land Cover and Land Use

### Global Permanent Monitoring Networks

#### Global Land Cover Estimation (**GLanCE**) training data

*Description*: [Global Land Cover Estimation (**GLanCE**) project](https://sites.bu.edu/measures/) project provides almost [2M training points](https://doi.org/10.34911/rdnt.x4xfh3) covering from years 1984 to 2020) [@Stanimirova2023].

```{r point-map-glance, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of GLanCE points. Image source: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-023-02798-5/figures/5.", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-glance.jpg")
```

-   `r emo::ji("link")` Project website: <https://sites.bu.edu/measures/>\
-   `r emo::ji("open_file_folder")` Data download URL: <https://doi.org/10.34911/rdnt.x4xfh3>\
-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license: CC-BY\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Stanimirova, R., Tarrio, K., Turlej, K., McAvoy, K., Stonebrook, S., Hu, K. T., ... & Friedl, M. A. (2023). [A global land cover training dataset from 1984 to 2020](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-023-02798-5). Scientific Data, 10(1), 879.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations: 2 million\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows: +20 million\
-   `r emo::ji("memo")` Tutorials & documentation: <https://sites.bu.edu/measures/tools/>

#### Globe230k

*Description*: Globe230k is a benchmark dataset for Global Land Cover Mapping which includes [cca 230,000 annotated images](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8429200) with a size of 512 × 512 and a spatial resolution of 1-m [@Shi2023].

```{r point-map-globe230k, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of Globe230k locations. Image source: @Shi2023.", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-globe230k.jpg")
```

-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license: CC-BY\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Shi, Q., He, D., Liu, Z., Liu, X., & Xue, J. (2023). [Globe230k: A Benchmark Dense-Pixel Annotation Dataset for Global Land Cover Mapping](https://doi.org/10.34133/remotesensing.0078). Journal of Remote Sensing, 3, 0078.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations: 6,500\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows: +1 billion\

#### Ocean Biodiversity Information System (OBIS)

*Description*: Collection of marine species occurrence records from original and 3rd party sources GBIF, FishBASE (Global Information System on Fishes) and similar [@moudry2020quality].

```{r point-map-obis, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of points for a species 'Scomber colias'. Image source: https://obis.org/taxon/151174.", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-obis.jpg")
```

-   `r emo::ji("link")` Project website: <https://obis.org/>\
-   `r emo::ji("open_file_folder")` Data download URL: <https://obis.org/data/access/>\
-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license: <https://manual.obis.org/access>\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Moudrý, V., & Devillers, R. (2020). [Quality and usability challenges of global marine biodiversity databases: An example for marine mammal data](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecoinf.2020.101051). Ecological Informatics, 56, 101051.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations:\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows: +57 million records\
-   `r emo::ji("memo")` Tutorials & documentation: <https://manual.obis.org/access>

#### Global streamflow time series data (GRDC)

*Description*: Global Runoff Data Centre (GRDC) collected 35 years of monthly and daily river discharge data from cca 11,000 permanent stations [@burek2023use].

```{r point-map-grdc, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of GRDC points. Image source: Global Runoff Data Centre (GRDC).", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-grdc.jpg")
```

-   `r emo::ji("link")` Project website: <https://www.bafg.de/GRDC/>\
-   `r emo::ji("open_file_folder")` Data download URL: <https://portal.grdc.bafg.de/applications/public.html>\
-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license: No commercial use of the data / No distribution of the entire database\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Burek, P., & Smilovic, M. (2023). [The use of GRDC gauging stations for calibrating large-scale hydrological models](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-15-5617-2023). Earth System Science Data, 15(12), 5617-5629.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations: 10,739\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows: +1 million records\
-   `r emo::ji("memo")` Tutorials & documentation: <https://github.com/iiasa/CWATM_grdc_calibration_stations/>

## Climate

### Global Permanent Monitoring Networks

#### NOAA Global Surface Summary of the Day (GSOD)

*Description*: Contains daily data from over 9000 stations (data from 1973 to the present) on Mean temperature (.1 Fahrenheit) Mean dew point (.1 Fahrenheit) Mean sea level pressure (.1 mb) Mean station pressure (.1 mb) Mean visibility (.1 miles) Mean wind speed (.1 knots) Maximum sustained wind speed (.1 knots) Maximum wind gust (.1 knots) Maximum temperature (.1 Fahrenheit) Minimum temperature (.1 Fahrenheit) Precipitation amount (.01 inches) Snow depth (.1 inches) Indicator for occurrence of: Fog, Rain or Drizzle, Snow or Ice Pellets, Hail, Thunder and similar.

```{r point-map-gsod, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of GSOD points. Image source: NOAA.", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-gsod.png")
```

-   `r emo::ji("link")` Project website: <https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/global-surface-summary-of-the-day-gsod/>\
-   `r emo::ji("open_file_folder")` Data download URL: <https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/data/global-summary-of-the-day/archive/>\
-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license:\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Sparks, A. H., Hengl, T., & Nelson, A. (2017). [GSODR: global summary daily weather data in R](https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.00177). Journal of open source software, 2(10), 177.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations: +9000\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows:\
-   `r emo::ji("memo")` Tutorials & documentation: <https://docs.ropensci.org/GSODR/>

#### Climate TRACE

*Description*: Climate TRACE provides an inventory of major source of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions around the world and provides independently produced estimates of how much each emits (points and polygons) [@whitmee2023accountability].

```{r point-map-climatetrace, echo=FALSE, fig.cap="Distribution of Climate TRACE points. Image source: The Climate TRACE coalition.", out.width="100%"}
knitr::include_graphics("images/point-map-climatetrace.jpg")
```

-   `r emo::ji("link")` Project website: <https://climatetrace.org/>\
-   `r emo::ji("open_file_folder")` Data download URL: <https://climatetrace.org/data/>\
-   `r emo::ji("news")` Data license: <https://roots.ornl.gov/guidelines/>\
-   `r emo::ji("closed_book")` Whitmee, S., Anton, B., & Haines, A. (2023). [Accountability for carbon emissions and health equity](https://doi.org/10.2471%2FBLT.22.289452). Bulletin of the World Health Organization, 101(2), 83.\
-   `r emo::ji("round_pushpin")` Unique locations: 352 million emitting assets\
-   `r emo::ji("clipboard")` Unique complete rows: +1 billion\
-   `r emo::ji("memo")` Tutorials & documentation: <https://api.climatetrace.org/v4/swagger/>
